OK, so as I just said it's language learning game about being lost in the city where you don't speak the language and the idea is that you've been shipwrecked on this island full of these weird anthropomorphic creatures and you don't understand a word of what's being said.
You can then learn words one at a time, to slowly begin to understand, and you learn words in one of two ways.
One is by clicking on objects in the environment.
So if you click on official in the word for fish.
If you click on a boat, you learn the word for boat and you can also talk to creatures in the environment.
So in the city here we have the opportunity to learn the word I and Roman.
And in the following example, we can learn the word bird using a little Riddle and kind of the whole trick of the game.
Is that words you know can be translated when they appear in the game again.
So the longer you've been playing, the more words you know.
The larger vocabulary is, and the more you'll be able to understand and feel at home in this strange place.

I forgot Arabic, which was added a little bit later.
Official languages, and by official I mean that these are the languages where I received paid translations using money that I received from the Kickstarter campaign in February.
These languages also have voice recordings, whereas the community translations don't have any voice recordings.
And also aren't necessarily completely complete.
